description: CHANGE OF USE FROM B1(c) (LIGHT INDUSTRIAL) TO A3 (RESTAURANT) WITH THE PROVISION OF A 3 SPACE CAR PARK TO THE FRONTAGE AND PROVISION OF A GARDEN TO THE REAR
decision_conditions: Condition : 1 - The development to which this permission relates shall be commenced not later than the expiration of 3 years from the date of this permission.

Condition : 2 - The development hereby permitted shall be carried out in accordance with the following approved plans: Site Location Plan, 693/PL/110 Rev A,  693/PL/111 Rev A, 693/PL/113, 693/PL/114, 693/PL/115 Rev A, 693/PL/116, 693/PL/117, 693/PL/118, 693/PLfront/110 rev A, 693/PLrear110 Rev B, 693/PLrear/116 Rev B and 693/Exfront/110 Rev A.

Condition : 3 - The facing materials to be used for the development hereby permitted shall be those specified in the application form unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.

Condition : 4 - The surface treatment to the rear garden/yard area shall be self-draining resin bonded gravel and shall be implemented prior to the first use of the restaurant hereby approved and maintained as such thereafter unless first agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.

Condition : 5 - Prior to the first use of the restaurant hereby granted permission, the proposed brick wall to then southern boundary of the rear yard/garden area shall be constructed to a height of no less than 1.8m and shall be retained as such thereafter.

Condition : 6 - Prior to the first use of the restaurant hereby granted permission, a scheme for the storage of refuse and recycling shall be submitted in writing for approval to the Local Planning Authority. No works which are the subject of this condition shall be carried out until the scheme has been approved, and the development shall not be
occupied until the scheme has been approved and has been carried out in full. Those facilities and measures shall thereafter be retained for use at all times from the date of first occupation.

Condition : 7 - The use of the external rear garden area shall be restricted as follows:

Use of external area to not commence prior to 10am with no customers to be seated after 9pm and with the area to be vacated by 10pm.
No food to be cooked outside.
No amplified music in the external area.
External area only to be used by seated customers.

Condition : 8 - Prior to the first use of the restaurant hereby granted permission, a written scheme to manage the control of odour from cooking shall be submitted and approved in writing by the LPA. The approved scheme shall be fully installed, maintained and serviced in accordance with the manufacturers' instructions or requirements, whilst the premises is open to serve food. The scheme submitted, including an odour risk assessment shall have regard to the technical requirements of the document ' Control of Odour and Noise from Commercial Kitchen Extract Systems as produced by EMAQ dated 2018.
Condition : 9 - Drainage serving the kitchen in commercial part of the premises shall be fitted with an adequate grease separator.

Condition : 10 - Noise levels, (expressed as the equivalent continuous sound level) LAeq (15 minutes), from any new plant/machinery installation shall not exceed LA90-10dB at the boundary with the closest noise sensitive property. Noise generated by amplified sound (including the playing of music, live or recorded) shall not be audible at the boundary with any noise sensitive property.

Condition : 11 - Prior to the first use of the restaurant hereby approved a scheme for external lighting shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The development shall be carried out in accordance with the approved scheme.

Condition : 12 - The vehicle parking area shown on the approved plans shall be provided before the commencement of the buildings or use hereby permitted and shall be retained for parking purposes for occupiers and users of the development and for no other purpose.

Condition : 13 - Prior to the first use of the restaurant hereby granted permission, details of secure cycle parking facilities for the occupants of, and visitors to, the development shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  The approved facilities shall be fully implemented and made available for use prior to the first occupation of the development and thereafter retained for use at all times.

Condition : 14 - The development shall be carried out in accordance with the Construction Method Statement submitted on 25/10/2020 and the accompanying drawing ref.693/Exfront/110 Rev A. The approved details must be implemented and complied with for the duration of the construction process.

Condition : 15 - If, during development, ground contamination not previously identified is found to be present at the site then no further development (unless otherwise agreed in writing with the Local Planning Authority) shall be carried out until the developer has submitted, and obtained written approval from the Local Planning Authority for, a remediation strategy detailing how this unsuspected contamination shall be dealt with. The remediation strategy shall be implemented as approved, verified and reported to the satisfaction of the Local Planning Authority.

Condition : 16 - No drainage systems for the infiltration of surface water drainage into the ground are permitted other than with the express written consent of the Local Planning Authority, which may be given for those parts of the site where it has been demonstrated that there is no resultant unacceptable risk to Controlled Waters. The development shall be carried out in accordance with the approval details.

Condition : 17 - In accordance with paragraph 38 of the NPPF, The London Borough of Merton (LBM) takes a positive and proactive approach to development proposals focused on solutions. LBM works with applicants/agents in a positive and proactive manner by:

   i) Offering a pre-application advice and duty desk service. 
   ii) Where possible, suggesting solutions to secure a successful outcome.
   iii) As appropriate, updating applicants/agents of any issues that may arise in the processing of their application.

In this instance:

   i) The applicant was offered the opportunity to discuss the proposal and agree additional restrictions on the proposed use in order to make the proposal acceptable in planning terms.

Condition : 18 - INFORMATIVE
Advice regarding permeable and porous hardstandings can be found in the document 'Guidance on the Permeable Surfacing of Front Gardens' available at http://www.communities.gov.uk/publications/planningandbuilding/pavingfrontgardens

Condition : 19 - This planning permission contains certain conditions precedent that state 'before development commences' 
or 'prior to commencement of any development' (or similar). As a result these must be discharged prior to ANY development activity taking place on site. Commencement of development without having complied with these conditions will make any development unauthorised and possibly subject to enforcement action such as a Stop Notice.
